Salah Belok di Amerika Serikat, Sekeluarga Turis Dideportasi
04 Nov 2019, 22:47 by Wahyu Setyo Widodo


Ilustrasi perbatasan AS (Reuters)

Washington - Sekeluarga turis dideportasi dari Amerika Serikat hanya gara-gara salah belok di perbatasan. Mereka mengaku tidak sengaja, tapi Imigrasi berkata sebaliknya.David dan Eileen Connors benar-benar apes. Mereka sekeluarga terpaksa harus dideportasi dari Amerika Serikat, setelah sebelumnya mendekam selama kurang lebih 2 minggu di ruang tahanan Federal AS.David terbukti melanggar aturan karena melintasi perbatasan Amerika Serikat-Kanada tanpa izin dan tujuan yang jelas. Mereka pun akan dikembalikan ke Inggris, meski David mengaku melakukan itu karena tidak sengaja akibat salah belok.Dikumpulkan detikTravel dari beberapa sumber, Senin (4/10/2019), cerita bermula ketika David sekeluarga secara tidak sengaja melintasi perbatasan AS-Kanada di negara bagian Washington. Saat itu, David berusaha untuk menghindari seekor satwa yang sedang menyeberang jalan.Tapi akibatnya, malah David masuk ke jalanan perbatasan AS-Kanada. Di sana, David diinterogasi oleh petugas Imigrasi AS. Mobilnya juga digeledah, dicurigai hendak menyelundupkan barang terlarang ke AS.Karena tidak bisa menjawab dan menjelaskan dengan gamblang maksud dan tujuannya melintasi perbatasan, David sekeluarga pun ditahan di ruang tahanan Berks County Residential Center sejak awal Oktober.Selama masa tahanan itu, David sekeluarga merasa diperlakukan dengan tidak layak. Ruang tahanannya kotor, kamar mandinya rusak, dan staffnya bersikap masa bodoh. Padahal saat itu David dan Eileen juga membawa serta anak kembar mereka, serta 2 anggota keluarganya yang lain.Pihak Imigrasi AS pun tidak serta merta percaya dengan alasan David. Mereka menganggap David melintasi perbatasan dengan sengaja. Fakta lain yang ditemukan, 2 anggota keluarga David pernah ditolak masuk ke AS. Wrong Turn in the United States, a Tourist Family Deported
04 Nov 2019, 22:47 by Wahyu Setyo Widodo


Illustration of US border (Reuters)

Washington - A family of tourists deported from the United States only because of a wrong turn at the border. They claimed to be inadvertent, but Immigration said otherwise. David and Eileen Connors were really unlucky. They and their families had to be deported from the United States, having previously spent less than 2 weeks in the US Federal detention room. David was proven to have broken the rules for crossing the United States-Canada border without a clear permit and purpose. They will also be returned to England, even though David claimed to do that because of accidental turning wrong. Collected detikTravel from several sources, Monday (10/04/2019), the story begins when David and his family accidentally crossed the US-Canada border in the state Washington. At that time, David tried to avoid an animal that was crossing the road. But as a result, instead David entered the US-Canada border road. There, David was interrogated by US Immigration officers. His car was also searched, suspected of smuggling prohibited goods into the US. Because he could not answer and clearly explain the purpose and purpose of crossing the border, David and his family were detained in the Berks County Residential Center detention center since early October. During the detention period, David and his family felt treated improperly. The detention room was dirty, the bathroom was broken, and the staff were acting stupid. Yet at that time David and Eileen also brought their twins, as well as 2 other family members. The US Immigration side did not necessarily believe in David's reasons. They considered David to cross the border on purpose. Another fact found, 2 members of David's family had been refused entry into the US.
